content:
I'd be grateful to get this PR resolved if anyone has time.

The main things it does are:

  • Adds the lemma complete_lattice.independent_iff_linear_independent_of_ne_zero
  • Replaces fintype_of_is_noetherian_linear_independent with linear_independent.finite_of_is_noetherian (thus relaxing an assumption of strong_rank_condition R to nontrival R)
  • Uses our new docs#finite and thus adds an import of data/finite/basic.lean into a moderately low-level file
I think finite should generally be available asap. If importing it is a problem, then I think that means we should make data.finite.basic lighter in terms of imports.
Just to be clear: I would be happy with merging this as is.

It's basically not a problem, IIRC, all-but-one of the issues I had to fix were just turning references from finite.of_fintype into set.finite.of_fintype to disambiguate between the new docs#finite.of_fintype and docs#set.finite.of_fintype.
:ping_pong:

I went looking for this the other day to review and couldn't find it, so assumed it was already merged. Left some minor comments, might have time to look again tomorrow if someone doesn't beat me to it.
